_description: This file contains assumption parameters for the Migros financing scenario. It overrides specific financing parameters from the base case.

_case_metadata.description: Migros Bank financing: 60% LTV, 1.8% interest (fixed for 5 years), no amortization

financing._explanation: Migros Bank offers alternative financing terms with lower LTV (60% vs 75%), higher interest rate (1.8% vs 1.3%), and no amortization requirement. This scenario evaluates the impact of these different financing terms on investment returns.
financing._ltv_explanation: 60% loan-to-value ratio is lower than the base case (75%), requiring more equity upfront (40% vs 25%). This reduces leverage but also reduces interest costs and improves cash flow. Migros Bank typically offers lower LTV ratios for investment properties.
financing._interest_rate_explanation: 1.8% annual interest rate is higher than the base case (1.3%) but is fixed for 5 years, providing rate certainty. After 5 years, the rate will need to be rolled/refinanced. This rate reflects Migros Bank's current offering for investment property mortgages.
financing._amortization_explanation: 0% amortization means pure interest payment with no principal paydown. This improves cash flow in the short term (no amortization expense) but means the loan balance remains constant. This is a common structure for investment properties where cash flow is prioritized over principal reduction.
